news.title: Giants CAPS United host new boys Scottland at Rufaro
news.content:
Story by Lawrence Trusida, Sport Editor
THEclash between CAPS United and Scottland FC set for Sunday at Rufaro stadium will headline the Castle Lager Premier Soccer League matchday two programme.
A mouth-watering clash is looming, with giants CAPS United hosting an expensively assembled side, Scottland at Rufaro Stadium on Sunday in arguably the match of the second round.
CAPS United picked up a point from their encounter against Green Fuel after coming from behind to force a one-all draw.
Scottland on the other hand had the perfect start, collecting maximum points against Triangle after a defensive mix-up gave them a one-nil victory on the stroke of full-time.
The two sides were very active in the transfer marketwith Makepekepe bolstering theirsquad with a few key playersthat includegoalkeeper Stephen Kwakuof Ghanaand midfielders Juan Mutudza and Tanaka Shandirwa.
On the other hand, Scottland had a total makeover from the team that was playing in Division One and among their top acquisitionsis2024 Soccer Star of the Year, Walter Musona, top goal scorer, Lynoth Chikuhwa and Khama Billiat.
The match will also see enterprising midfielder Kingsley Mureremba and utility defender Godknows Murirwa facing their former paymasters for the first time since leaving the former champions.
PSL action however starts on Friday with Yadah hosting Chicken Inn at the Heart stadium, with both sides seeking their first win of the season after being held in their opening day matches.
Saturday sees FC Platinum taking on Manica Diamonds in a potentially explosive encounter at Mandava Stadium, ambitious TelOne date Triangle at Ascot Stadium in Gweru, whileBikita Minerals welcome MWOS to Sakubva Stadium.
ZPC Kariba host defending champions, Simba Bhora at Nyamhungastadiumwhile Herentals take on Dynamos at Rufaro Stadium.
Action continues on Sunday when Highlanders host league debutants Kwekwe United at Barbourfields Stadium.

news.title: ZIFA partners Kyros Sports and PD House to boost local football
news.content:
Story by Lawrence Trusida, Sports Editor
THE Zimbabwe Football Association (ZIFA) has signed two Memoranda of Understanding with two local firms to help in talent identification and marketing of the local game.
ZIFA has started the process of addressing the challenges in monitoring and tracking athletes from a tender age after partnering Kyros Sports in Harare this Monday.
Kyros Sports has a big imprint in talent identification and athletes tracking and has been working with the Zimbabwe Rugby Union to build a solid player base.
Under the MOU with ZIFA, Kyros will be working with schools to create a clear pathway for young athletes, ensuring the next generation of football stars get opportunities.
ZIFA president Nqobile Magwizi said, “I think you all know what they have done in rugby and we want such kind of services. So we are also going to be working so much with the NAPH and NASH. The goal is to have a solid player base and be able to qualify for major tournaments consistently.”
“We are more into data collection and latest scientific technologies through our collaborations and we hope we can help ZIFA achieve their goals,” Kyros Sports’ director Nyasha Muchochomi said.
ZIFA also joined hands with a digital marketing company, PD House that is set to push their projects online.
PD House’s director Martin Mukaro noted, “We are more than just a company of websites, we also do applications and market content digitally and we will help ZIFA to push their content and spread the message of Zimbabwe Football.”

news.title: New boys Scottland, MWOS steal the show as giants stumble
news.content:
Story by Lawrence Trusida, Sports Editor
PREMIER Soccer League new-boys Scottland and MWOS had a perfect start to their campaign in the top flight after registering wins in their debut matches at the weekend.
Scottland FC showed their intent after recruiting marquee players ahead of the start of the Premier Soccer League (PSL).
The Mabvuku-based side were duly rewarded in their debut match in the league after edging Triangle one-nil at Rufaro Stadium in the season opener.
The new boys were not at the level that everyone expected but the three points were sweeter in a debut match.
The own goal gave them victory and their first set of three points.
On Sunday, fellow newcomers, MWOS also needed lady luck to beat Highlanders at Baobab stadium after a mistake from Bosso goalkeeper Raphael Pitisi.
The Norton-based side caused Bosso further problems and could have gone away with a wide margin.

news.title: Bonaqua Africa Triathlon Cup set for March 8th
news.content:
Story by Lawrence Trusida, Sports Editor
THE Bonaqua Africa Triathlon Cup is set to be held on March 8, at its usual venue, the Troutbeck Resort in Nyanga.
The event draws elite triathletes from across the world who will be vying for ranking points to qualify for other global events and the upcoming 2028 Olympic Games.
Youngsters will also be battling to be continental champions in the Junior Africa Cup.
Zimbabwe has predominantly featured athletes in the Junior Africa Cup but they have struggled for representation in the Elite categories.
